example_sentence_english: I want to mean something important.
I am meaning the opposite.
I meant it clearly.
I meant it with a gesture.

example_sentence_italian: Li ho significati in quel contesto.
example_sentence_english: I meant them in that context.
I meant them all.
I mean what I say.
You mean something different.
This means a lot to me.
We mean the same thing.
You (plural) mean something important.
They mean many different things.

example_sentence_italian: Da bambino significavo le cose in modo diverso.
example_sentence_english: As a child I meant things differently.

example_sentence_italian: Fino a ieri tu significavi poco per me.
example_sentence_english: Until yesterday you meant little to me.

translation_english: he was meaning/she was meaning/you (formal) were meaning
example_sentence_english: For him this meant freedom.
We meant a united team.

example_sentence_italian: Voi significavate molto per la comunità.
example_sentence_english: You (plural) meant a lot to the community.
The words meant something else then.

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'significato'

notes: used with auxiliary avere; past participle 'significato'

example_sentence_english: Have you meant something by that gesture?
